algorithm_technique: Graph traversal (BFS) on an implicit graph representing the tree, including parent pointers.
problem_summary_simple: Find the leaf node closest to a given node with value k in a binary tree.
problem_summary_technical: Builds an adjacency list for the tree (including parent links) and performs BFS from k to find the nearest leaf.
key_insights: Treat the tree as an undirected graph where edges connect parent-child relationships.
BFS is suitable for finding the shortest path in an unweighted graph.
Need to identify all leaf nodes beforehand or during traversal.
